data.title: Custom tree views: Expanding an initially collapsed tree node triggers full recursive loading of collapsed child nodes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a custom tree view where there is a collapsed node with children that in turn are collapsed as well (with children etc. of their own).
2. Add a log statement in `getChildren()` to observe loading.
3. Run the extension and click on the collapsed node. Observe how the *whole* subtree is loaded even though only the next level is displayed.

This is a massive problem when you rely on lazy loading for cases when loading a full subtree is not feasible and relies on heavier operations. Given that lazy loading seems to be applied for the initial tree state I assume this is some kind of bug.

data.title: File(s) flicker and show in incorrect VSCode instance.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional - Service Pack 1 - 64-bit OS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open project 1, full screen, on Monitor 1.
2. Open project 2, full screen, on Monitor 2.
3. Move mouse between the two monitors. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

When using VSCode in my Windows environment, with multiple "new windows" open in full screen mode, the file from VSCode instance 1 will flash in instance 2 and vice-versa. In the example I have a sample elixir project open in the window being recorded. On the other monitor I have a node project open and I am viewing autossr.js. Notice how the .ex file will flash as my mouse moves from monitor 1 to monitor 2. You will also notice the the filename tab will change from conn.ex to autossr.js. 

I created a .gif to show what I am talking about. It is rather long but shows that it does not happen on every mouse move and happens with different levels of severity.

![vscode_multiple_full_size_instances_windows7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/682850/27881352-bf857f5e-6174-11e7-98df-d02db6a919fd.gif)

src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/node/taskConfiguration:English (en):plaintext:TaskParse.noOsSpecificGlobalTasks

vs_workbench_parts_tasks

Task version 2.0.0 doesn't support gloabl OS specific tasks. Convert them to a task with a OS specific command. Affected tasks are: {0}

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|theme-dracula|dracula-theme|2.1.3|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|vsc-material-theme|Equinusocio|1.0.0|

|Go|lukehoban|0.6.62|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.11.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.9.1|;


---

This is an enhancement, not a bug report. I believe `vscode` should update the git gutters after you commit a staged file. It doesn't do so on my system and with my current installed version of `vscode`.

Thoughts?

data.title: Open second window as an Administrator
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (6afdf303bb8f70d840c12a43c036e98a9da50d41, 2017-07-05T08:33:33.146Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
angular2-snippets|dan|1.0.15
githistory|don|0.2.1
python|don|0.6.7
Angular1|joh|0.2.0
Angular2|joh|2.3.3
mssql|ms-|1.0.0
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
team|ms-|1.119.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6
vscode-icons|rob|7.10.1
vscode-gulp|tan|0.0.4



---

Hi, I do not seem to be able to open an additional window as an administrator.
First case scenario, if VS code is already open normally, i cannot open a window as an administrator.
Second case is when it is already opened as an administrator - same repro steps

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Pin VS Code to your task bar (to make this simpler)
2. Right click on VS Code icon in your taskbar
3. On the context menu, right click the "Visual Studio Code - Insiders" menu item (3rd from the bottom) and select Run as administrator, VS code opens
4. repeat step 2 and 3.

Expected:
5. A second window opens as administrator

Actual:
5. Nothing seems to happen


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Show status when updating VSCode and extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0 - Insiders (6afdf30 - Date 2017-07-05T08:33:33.146Z )
- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

It may be related to #25632 and #18450.

It would be nice to show a percentage (with a progress bar) or estimated time when the VSCode was updated, along with the speed we are downloading.

You currently have no indication of the [process](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dn742475(v=vs.85).aspx).

![progresstext](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19866231/27874582-68c218b4-6186-11e7-8498-646e1c0a07cb.PNG)


So for VSCode when it is downloading I suggest:

1 - Clicking to check for updates opens a window indicating whether it is in the latest version or not. (I suggest a similar window to About Firefox, even open still allows in browser.)
2 - If the automatic updates are disabled, it should inform you that there is a new version with a button to 'Update'.
If it is automatic the same should indicate a percentage (with a progress bar) or estimated time to download along with the speed we are downloading.
3 - If the download is happening without the window being opened or closed, in the icon of the gear where a blue notification appears, could have in the same position the following animation showing how much progress has been made.

![progress](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19866231/27874360-a383a158-6185-11e7-8854-4296134d3072.gif)



For the extensions I suggest (whether automatic or not.):

1- Have the following animation, but changing for the existing cores.
In this case I would follow the same layout (two colors) of this gif. As soon as you clicked to install / update
Up to 50% of the bar corresponds to the download, that is to say 'Downloading'. Already the other 50% would be the installation, ie it would be written 'Installing'.
The first 50% corresponds to 100% of the download and the other 50% corresponds to 100% of the installation.

![progress2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19866231/27874373-ad33e7bc-6185-11e7-8b13-ba2d4582c5a9.gif)



2- If the download is automatically happening in the icon of the extension where a blue notification appears, it could have in the same position the following animation showing how much has been progressed, of the total extensions that have to update.

![progress](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19866231/27874382-b136ef3a-6185-11e7-874f-df84ea8e87c9.gif)



Other suggestions are welcome !! Any doubts about the text, please ask for there to be no misinterpretation by the use of Google Translate.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Change position to select when we click on the status bar options
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0 - Insiders (6afdf30 - Date 2017-07-05T08:33:33.146Z )
- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

One suggestion would be that when we click on the options that exist in the status bar, it will appear next to it.

![lines](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19866231/27873457-95082458-6182-11e7-94b5-98f42c909e97.PNG)
![indent](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19866231/27873460-99c06eec-6182-11e7-9563-fe4316b0c865.PNG)

As for the search bar I would vote for being at the bottom (different from how the images are) next to the own status bar.

data.title: Non-user friendly error message when attempting to search a project folder that is now unaccessible
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 17.0.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |output-colorizer|IBM|0.1.1| |material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.10| |vscode-theme-onedark|akamud|2.0.2| |monokai-plusplus|dcasella|1.6.0| |githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.1| |theme-dracula|dracula-theme|2.1.3| |php-intellisense|felixfbecker|1.4.3| |ftp-sync|lukasz-wronski|0.3.3| |vscode-apache|mrmlnc|1.1.1| |typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.23| |language-stylus|sysoev|1.7.3| |twig|whatwedo|1.0.2| |Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.9.1|; --- I am using SSHFS to mount directories through an SSH connection. Without realising, one of my connections dropped out. I went to do a search across the project through VS code and got the error: "spawn ENXIO" I expected more of a message such as "Failed to search as the project can no longer be found" or at least "Error whilst trying to search", but got "spawn ENXIO" instead. Steps to Reproduce: Since I used SSHFS, I'll give the steps to reproduce the issue this way. 1. Mount a directory through SSHFS 2. Open said directory as a project 3. Unmount said directory so it's no longer connected through SSHFS and no longer accessible 4. Try to do a search across the project Here is a screenshot showing the error message and how it appears. I don't know if it's OS specific. I'm using SSHFS from OSXFUSE which I obtained through the Homebrew package manager on macOS

JS files may be used with TS via `allowJs`/`checkJs`.

data.title: Smooth scrolling with mouse
data.body:
Since some update of VS Code (unfortunately I don't remember which one) scrolling with the mouse is not smooth anymore. Scrolling occurs in steps of three lines no matter how slowly I turn the wheel. Using the touchpad everything works fine.

Before the update I also had an issue with it. I set "editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity" to some custom value. After a restart of VS code I had to change the value, safe the settings, and only then it worked again as expected. Maybe this is related?

data.title: Editor Freezes Frequently in Windows 10, then Resumes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
### Environment
- Windows 10
- v1.13 (& also Insiders Edition)

### Behaviour
- The editor freezes while typing, copying, clicking to place cursor:  
  * cursor does not move or flash
   * all menus and controls within the editor become unresponsive
- After an interval of between 10 - 30 seconds, the editor picks up where it left off (i.e. 'catches-up' with any typing /copying/pasting, navigation).
- Freeze does not affect any other open application / task-bar / desktop
- Behavior is very frequent (once every 5 minutes or more).

### Steps to Reproduce
- open editor
- open any file
- begin typing, place cursor, copy / paste or navigate

### Other Information
- Behaviour recent (started since 29 June, 2017)
- Behaviour occurs with __Insiders Edition__
- Behaviour occurs with extensions disabled / uninstalled
- Editor virtually unusable while this behaviour persists

data.title: Center align keybindings in quick open
data.body: Part of #28602 --- So I had a look and i know what's going on and why it's difficult to center this. It's hard because the `.monaco-kbkey` style uses `line-height` to size the background of the button. A negative `margin-top` is used to work around this since the size is fixed to 22px from what I can tell. --- There is one remaining issue however, this PR fixes the alignment of all items except for those containing a separator which is 1px off: The reason this is off is because the size of `.results-group-separator` is 23px but its parent `.monaco-tree-row` is set to `22px`, meaning the last pixel is being hidden via `overflow:hidden`. The right fix here is to move the `.results-group-separator` class up one level to the `.monaco-tree-row` level and adjust it's height to 23px. Setting it manually in devtools to 23px seems to work just right: @bpasero @joaomoreno I don't feel like I know the code well enough to make this last change, will probably take no time at all for one of you though 😄

data.title: Intellisense and code navigation don't work well when webpack has modules
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Version 1.14.0-insider (1.14.0-insider)
- OS Version: macos sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  clone this [repo](https://github.com/zanza00/vscode-intellisense) (it's an almost clean react boilerplate)
1. `yarn` or `npm i` 
2. open `app/containers/HomePage`
2. intellisense for react and other modules is not working 
2. it's possible to navigate to`SimpleDiv`
2. sometimes for no reason intellisense stops to resolve module starting from `app`, restarting tsserver does not resolve the problem

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

I have tried a lot of combinations in the `tsconfig.json` but I was not able to make it works with code completion from npm (react, PropTypes, lodash) _and_ from my code from `app`

if I use the `path` options and put node_modules inside it kinda works.

Also if I am doing something wrong let me know.

Thanks in advance
